intro: Pedicularis gracilituba subsp. setosa, commonly known as the hairy beard tongue, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Scrophulariaceae. It is characterized by its slender, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The subspecies is distinguished by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. It is native to mountainous regions of Asia, particularly in China and the Tibetan Plateau. This plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats.
